DOC.brief_title: Effects Community-based Caring Contact Post-discharge Young Adults With Self-harm
DOC.detailed_description: The propose study determine whether community-based care contact via mobile app connection without volunteer support addition treatment usual ( TAU ; psychiatric psychosocial treatment ) effective reduce suicidal ideation , enhance treatment compliance , reduce thwart belongingness perceive burdensomeness hopelessness among post-discharge self-harm young adult , personalize contact volunteer additional effect reduce suicidal ideation among post-discharge self-harm individual . 108 participant age 18-39 index self-harm episode recruit Accident & Emergency Department ( AED ) 4 local public hospital , randomize TAU , mobile app group , without volunteer support . Each participant complete questionnaire 4 measurement time point baseline , 6-month observation ( 3 6 month ) post-intervention ( 9 month baseline ) . The primary outcome include Suicidal ideation , hopelessness , thwart belongingness & perceive burdensomeness , treatment ( TAU ) compliance , suicidality .
